thread.title: Sunderland could be handed massive injury boost
thread.title_full: Sunderland could be handed massive injury boost

title: Sunderland could be handed massive injury boost
text:
GETTY Jordan Pickford could return from injury sooner than expected 
The England prospect is on course to make his comeback in early February, having initially been ruled out for two months. 
Pickford, who had been in outstanding form for the Black Cats, strained knee ligaments in the 3-1 defeat against Manchester United at Old Trafford last month. 
But the highly-rated 22-year-old goalkeeper has already resumed light training and is targeting a return within four weeks. 
GETTY David Moyes has seen his Sunderland side ravaged by injuries “We think he could be ahead of schedule” David Moyes 
“Jordan’s doing well,” said Moyes. “We think he could be ahead of schedule. 
“We certainly don’t think it will be eight weeks, closer to being six if anything at the moment. 
“He feels good but that can only be tested once he’s back at it.” 
GETTY Vito Mannone has been solid in relief of Jordan Pickford 
Vito Mannone bounced back from a nightmare display at Burnley to perform well in his next two outings. 
But Moyes, who described Pickford’s injury as “a huge loss,” is desperate to have the youngster available, believing he could be crucial to Sunderland’s survival prospects. Related articles
